param.name: ampfactor_file
param.caption: use Borcherdt-style site correction tables
param.doc:
File containing the Ma and Mv factors for short- and mid-period amps as a function of input acceleration in g. the path is relative to $shake_home; lib/sitecorr/Borcherdt94.dat is the default. Old-style Borcherdt tables will not work with the new site amplification functions. Do not specify an old-style table below unless you run grind with -oldsc.
If the user calls grind with -oldsc, the old-style Borcherdt table MUST be specified below, e.g.:
ampfactor_file : lib/sitecorr/site_corr_cdmg.dat
The structure of the old-style table is very different from the new table. See site_corr_cdmg.dat as an example, and src/lib/SiteCorrGrd.pm for a more detailed explanation of the structure.
